    • Method Detail

      • resolve

        public java.util.Collection<com.ipt.ebsa.deployment.descriptor.ResolvedHost> resolve(com.ipt.ebsa.deployment.descriptor.XMLDeploymentDescriptorType deploymentDescriptor,
                                                                            java.lang.String rawHostnames,
                                                                            java.lang.String zoneName,
                                                                            java.lang.String schemeName,
                                                                            java.lang.String environment)
                                                                              throws HostnameResolver.UnresolvableHostOrRoleException
        Resolves the hostname by performing a looking against the deployment schemes, if any. The rules are:
        • if there is no scheme for the current zone then the values provided in the hostnames tag can be taken as literals
        • if there is a scheme the target(s) matching the hostnames should be used, otherwise the hostnames tag can be taken literally
        • When the hostnames tag contains a csv list then the list should be parsed and each item should be replaced appropriately, if one is a literal and the other is based on a scheme then thats ok.
        Parameters:
        deploymentDescriptor - Deployment data from which to obtain the deployment schemes
        rawHostnames - The hostnames string to interpret.
        zoneName - Only used in scheme and literal modes
        schemeName - Only used in scheme mode, likely to actually be null
        environment - Only used in environment mode, null in scheme mode
        Returns:
        Throws:
        HostnameResolver.UnresolvableHostOrRoleException

        private java.util.Collection<com.ipt.ebsa.deployment.descriptor.ResolvedHost> resolveFromEnvironments(com.ipt.ebsa.deployment.descriptor.XMLDeploymentDescriptorType deploymentDescriptor,

      • getSchemeScope

        public static java.util.Collection<com.ipt.ebsa.deployment.descriptor.ResolvedHost> getSchemeScope(com.ipt.ebsa.deployment.descriptor.DeploymentDescriptor dd,
                                                                                   java.lang.String zone,
                                                                                   java.lang.String schemeName)
        Try to determine the scope for this deployment by determining the scheme that is in effect.
        Parameters:
        dd - The deployment descriptor
        zone - The zone name, e.g. 'HO_IPT_NP_PRP2_DAZO' or 'IPT_ST_SIT1_COR1'
        schemeName - (Optional) The configured scheme name from UI, likely to be null
        Returns:
        the scope from the scheme, or null if no scoping is in place (i.e. the scope is the whole zone)

      • getEnvironmentScopes

        public static java.util.Collection<com.ipt.ebsa.deployment.descriptor.ResolvedHost> getEnvironmentScopes(com.ipt.ebsa.deployment.descriptor.DeploymentDescriptor dd,
                                                                                         java.lang.String environment,
                                                                                         java.lang.String zoneName,
                                                                                         java.lang.String variant)
        Try to determine the scope for this deployment by determining the zone that is in effect.
        Parameters:
        dd - The deployment descriptor
        environment - The environment name, e.g. 'HO_IPT_NP_PRP2' or 'IPT_ST_SIT1'
        zoneName - (Optional) The configured zone name from UI, likely to be null
        variant - (Optional) The variant of the environment to search for.
        Returns:
        the scope from the zone, or null if no scoping is in place (i.e. the scope is the whole environment)
